title: Seeking Castaway complement
content:
Hello, I am searching out ideas for a print project. I am looking for a text font to use with the (House) font [Castaway](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017203254/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=27&subpage=viewfontspecimens) (which I am using for headers). This is a fun eatery guide. Target is vegetarians. Needs to complement whimsical illustrations and be easily read at 10 or 11 pts. Something on the lines of [Cafeteria](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017203254/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/cafeteria/), but not Cafeteria as it is too condensed. Something playful, but no crazy hand lettering. Suggestions greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

 [‹ Id this type in Luottokuntas logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017203254/http:/typophile.com/node/38129 "Go to previous forum topic") [Church identity and font licensing ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017203254/http:/typophile.com/node/38071 "Go to next forum topic")
author: girlwithglasses

comments.content:
Not for long text, but [MVB Grenadine](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017203254/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=grenadine) or [MVB Pedestria](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017203254/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mvb_fonts/mvb_pedestria/) might be just the thing.

Otherwise, [FF Sari](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017203254/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_sari_1/) would complement Castaway well and can be set in long paragraphs.
MVB Grenadine is great! and is right on the lines of what I am looking for. FF Sari reminds me of Barmeno (?) (I think that was the name) and is a good second choice. Thanks!
FF Sari is the successor to Barmeno. An improvement by the same designer, [Hans Reichel](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017203254/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hans%252BReichel).
